title: The movement to recall Gavin Newsom | Today, Explained in 10
description:
Early in the pandemic, California Governor Gavin Newsom got credit for keeping Covid-19 cases low in his state. Now, over a million Californians want him recalled. The Los Angeles Times’ Melanie Mason explains.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
itunes:title: The movement to recall Gavin Newsom | Today, Explained in 10
itunes:author: Vox
itunes:subtitle: Organizers of the petition to recall Gavin Newsom say they’ve obtained close to two million signatures, well over the threshold to trigger a recall
